pageContext.content:
I am a professional artist living in Herefordshire, England UK.

The majority of my work is of the Herefordshire landscape, not just the rivers and streams but buildings in villages and towns, capturing the character and style of bygone architecture. Several of my paintings, with timber framed houses and buildings of immense beauty have been produced from old black and white photographs, as the scenes depicted no longer exist.

I have had my paintings exhibited in over sixty venues as well as having prints and cards on permanent display in shops and galleries, and now I am able to offer my work via this website.

latest.description:
The River Fowey can be crossed between Bodinnick and Fowey by a small car ferry, this cuts out a long drive around the esturary. Since 1869 the harbour including the estuary has been managed by the Fowey Harbour Commissioners and more than 7,000 yachts and pleasure craft visit during a typical season.

Original watercolour, image size 14" x 10 ".

Mounted to fit frame size 20" x 16".

Price £245

A signed, embossed limited edition print, mounted to fit frame size 14"x 11" is available.

Price £45.
latest.metaDescription: Watercolour painting of Fowey, Cornwall. By Herefordshire artist David J. Fry.

latest.title: Fowey, Cornwall.

latest.description:

latest.description:
Bideford is a historical port town on the estuary of the River Torridge in north Devon. Records show that before there was a bridge there was a ford where the river is lowest at 'low tide', it is possible (but not advisable) to cross the river by wading on foot.

The Welsh, "bydd y ffordd" means "this is the way" or "this is the road" owing to the Celtic legacy and the common ancestry with the Welsh.

Original watercolour, image size 14"x10".

Mounted to fit 20"x16" frame.

£245

A signed, embossed print is available £45
latest.metaDescription: Watercolour painting of Bideford, Devon, By Herefordshire artist David J. Fry
latest.paypalEmbedCode: P816 Bideford
latest.title: Bideford, Devon

latest.description:
St. Michael's Mount is a tidal Island in Mount's Bay, Cornwall.

The Island is linked to the town of Marazion by a man made causeway of granite Blocks, passable between mid-tide and low water. It is managed by the National Trust and the castle and chapel have been home to the St. Aubyn family since approximately 1650. The earliest building on the summit, including the castle, date to the 12th century.

Original watercolour, image size 13.75" x 10".

Mounted to fit frame size 20" x 16".

Price £245

The signed, embossed limited edition print, mounted to fit frame size 14"x 11"

Price £45
